materials.name: High-Density Foam Insulation Board
materials.description: Type of thermal insulation material known for its excellent insulating properties. It is often used in construction for its high R-value and energy-saving features.

materials.name: Fiberglass Batt Insulation
materials.description: Popular choice for its affordability and ease of installation. It is used in walls, attics, and crawl spaces for thermal insulation.

materials.name: Polystyrene Foam Sheets
materials.description: Lightweight and durable. They are commonly used in construction as insulation materials for their moisture resistance and thermal insulation properties.

materials.name: Cementitious Fireproofing
materials.description: Fire-resistant material applied to structural components. It offers protection against high temperatures and is used in industrial and commercial buildings.

materials.name: Reflective Foil Insulation
materials.description: Consists of layers of aluminum foil and plastic materials. It reflects heat and is used to provide thermal insulation in attics and walls.

materials.name: Cellulose Insulation
materials.description: Made from recycled paper products. It is an eco-friendly choice and provides effective thermal insulation in homes and buildings.

materials.name: Aerogel Insulation
materials.description: Highly efficient insulating material known for its low thermal conductivity. It is used in aerospace and extreme temperature applications.

materials.name: Spray Foam Insulation
materials.description: Versatile material that expands upon application. It creates a tight seal and is used for both thermal insulation and air sealing.

materials.name: Blown-In Fiberglass Insulation
materials.description: Made of tiny glass fibers and is applied by blowing or spraying. It is used to insulate attics and walls for thermal efficiency.

materials.name: Polyisocyanurate Board Insulation
materials.description: Type of rigid foam insulation. It is known for its high R-value and is used in roofs, walls, and foundations for thermal insulation.
